meta.title: noex - Erlang/OTP Patterns for Node.js
meta.description: Build fault-tolerant, scalable systems with TypeScript using battle-tested Erlang/OTP patterns

hero.headline: Erlang/OTP Patterns for Node.js
hero.subheadline: Build fault-tolerant, scalable systems with TypeScript

whyNoex.title: Why noex?
whyNoex.subtitle: Node.js is fast and flexible, but building reliable distributed systems requires proven patterns. noex brings battle-tested Erlang/OTP concepts to TypeScript, so you can focus on your business logic instead of infrastructure.

proven.title: Battle-tested patterns
proven.description: GenServer, Supervisor, Registry - concepts that power WhatsApp, Discord, and millions of telecom systems worldwide. Now available in your TypeScript codebase.

faultTolerant.title: Fault-tolerant by design
faultTolerant.description: Embrace the 'let it crash' philosophy. Processes fail gracefully and supervisors automatically restart them. No more cascading failures bringing down your entire app.

distributed.title: Distributed from day one
distributed.description: The same code that runs on one machine scales across a cluster. Location-transparent messaging means you don't rewrite anything when you need to scale.

observable.title: Observable out of the box
observable.description: Built-in web dashboard and terminal UI show you exactly what's happening. See process states, message throughput, and errors in real-time without any configuration.

problem.title: Node.js is great, but...
problem.subtitle: Common challenges that slow down development and cause production issues

raceConditions.title: Race Conditions
raceConditions.description: Shared mutable state leads to unpredictable bugs

errorHandling.title: Error Cascades
errorHandling.description: One failure can crash your entire application

scaling.title: Scaling Complexity
scaling.description: Distributed systems are hard to get right

features.title: Core Concepts
features.subtitle: Battle-tested patterns from Erlang/OTP, reimagined for TypeScript

genserver.title: GenServer
genserver.description: Stateful processes without race conditions. Sequential message processing guarantees consistency.

supervisor.title: Supervisor
supervisor.description: Automatic restart on failures. Let it crash philosophy with smart recovery strategies.

registry.title: Registry
registry.description: Named process lookup. Find processes by name instead of managing references.

patterns.title: Advanced Patterns
patterns.subtitle: Higher-level abstractions for common concurrency scenarios

genStateMachine.title: GenStateMachine
genStateMachine.description: Explicit finite state machines with typed states and transitions. Perfect for workflows and protocols.

agent.title: Agent
agent.description: Simple state container when you need just state, not a full process. Functional updates with get/update.

task.title: Task
task.description: Supervised async operations with concurrency control. Run fire-and-forget jobs or await results.

application.title: Application Framework
application.subtitle: Complete lifecycle management for production-ready applications

descriptions.lifecycle: Consistent startup sequence with health checks. Start, stop, and monitor your application with a unified API.
descriptions.signals: Automatic SIGINT/SIGTERM handling for Docker and Kubernetes. Your processes clean up properly.
descriptions.graceful: prepStop hooks give services time to drain. Configurable timeouts prevent hanging shutdowns.

services.title: Built-in Services
services.subtitle: Production-ready utilities that work seamlessly with your processes

cache.title: Cache
cache.description: In-memory caching with TTL and automatic cleanup

ratelimiter.title: RateLimiter
ratelimiter.description: Token bucket rate limiting for APIs and resources

ets.title: ETS
ets.description: Erlang Term Storage - fast in-memory key-value store with pattern matching

observability.title: Observability Built-in
observability.subtitle: Monitor your processes in real-time with zero configuration

descriptions.tui: Interactive terminal dashboard with keyboard navigation
descriptions.metrics: Real-time CPU, memory, and message throughput

distribution.title: Distributed by Design
distribution.subtitle: Scale across machines with location transparency. Your processes work the same whether on one machine or hundreds.

descriptions.cluster: Nodes automatically discover each other using mDNS or seed nodes. No central coordinator required.
descriptions.global: Register and find processes across all nodes by name. One API for local and remote processes.
descriptions.transparent: Send messages to processes regardless of their physical location. The runtime handles routing.
